channel.title: wweb.dev
channel.description: Stay up to date with weekly updates, get resources for next project and read articles and tutorials about web development.

item.title: Pure CSS Loader Generator
item.description: A code generator that helps you to create simple CSS spinners. You can choose between four different types of CSS spinners and customize them by adjusting the settings.
item.content:encoded: A code generator that helps you to create simple CSS spinners. You can choose between four different types of CSS spinners and customize them by adjusting the settings.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Coding your own AI in 2023 with fastai
item.description: This is a guide, which focuses on the critical parts of the fastai course. I'll cover how to set up the ecosystem and how to create, train and deploy an AI model.
item.content:encoded: This is a guide, which focuses on the critical parts of the fastai course. I'll cover how to set up the ecosystem and how to create, train and deploy an AI model.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Best of Weekly Resources 2019-2022
item.description: Exactly three years ago I published my first weekly newsletter. Since then I've sent out 125 Emails with a total of 1345 resources. Here are the 110 most clicked links.
item.content:encoded: Exactly three years ago I published my first weekly newsletter. Since then I've sent out 125 Emails with a total of 1345 resources. Here are the 110 most clicked links.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Next.js Web App Template
item.description: A template to quickly set up a web app or SaaS. It includes the basic authentication logic using MongoDB as well as password reset logic with nodemailer.
item.content:encoded: A template to quickly set up a web app or SaaS. It includes the basic authentication logic using MongoDB as well as password reset logic with nodemailer.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Blur Background CSS Generator
item.description: A tool to generate the CSS for a customized blur background. Afterward, you can easily copy the code and use it on your website.
item.content:encoded: A tool to generate the CSS for a customized blur background. Afterward, you can easily copy the code and use it on your website.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Next.js Micro-blogging Template
item.description: A Next.js template for a twitter-like blog. You can write in markdown and upload images and videos.
item.content:encoded: A Next.js template for a twitter-like blog. You can write in markdown and upload images and videos.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Next.js Blog Template
item.description: This is a simple blog template to quickly get started with writing. It has a clean design and provides a lot of flexibility.
item.content:encoded: This is a simple blog template to quickly get started with writing. It has a clean design and provides a lot of flexibility.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: A guide to debugging JavaScript in Visual Studio Code
item.description: In this post, I will show how to set up debugging for Javascript in VS Code for Node.js and for React in Firefox or Chrome...
item.content:encoded: In this post, I will show how to set up debugging for Javascript in VS Code for Node.js and for React in Firefox or Chrome...

item.title: JavaScript Object Functions Cheat Sheet
item.description: A Cheat Sheet to quickly find all functions that can be executed on a JavaScript Object. It includes a quick explanation, the syntax and an example.
item.content:encoded: A Cheat Sheet to quickly find all functions that can be executed on a JavaScript Object. It includes a quick explanation, the syntax and an example.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Responsive Navigation Generator
item.description: Quickly get the HTML and CSS for a customizable menu. It will be responsive and it turns to a burger menu on mobile, completely without JavaScript.
item.content:encoded: Quickly get the HTML and CSS for a customizable menu. It will be responsive and it turns to a burger menu on mobile, completely without JavaScript.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Getting Started with Serverless AWS (3/3) - Micro Services using Lambda, DynamoDB & API Gateway
item.description: In this part, we're creating a DynamoDB. Then we create a Lambda for creating, reading, updating, and deleting entries in that database. And last we create...
item.content:encoded: In this part, we're creating a DynamoDB. Then we create a Lambda for creating, reading, updating, and deleting entries in that database. And last we create...
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Getting Started with Serverless AWS (2/3) - Distribute an S3 Bucket with CloudFront and add a Domain
item.description: In this part we're going to add CloudFront to deliver our website content with low latency to the user. Afterward, we'll add a domain with HTTPs for our website...
item.content:encoded: In this part we're going to add CloudFront to deliver our website content with low latency to the user. Afterward, we'll add a domain with HTTPs for our website...
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Getting Started with Serverless AWS (1/3) - Deploying a Static Website to S3
item.description: In this series, we're creating a serverless stack using AWS. In this part, I'll show how to serve a static website through an S3 Bucket and how to deploy from your local machine...
item.content:encoded: In this series, we're creating a serverless stack using AWS. In this part, I'll show how to serve a static website through an S3 Bucket and how to deploy from your local machine...
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: How to craft appealing websites
item.description: When I started developing websites I never knew where to start, when creating a new one. Over time I came up with a process that helped me not only getting started, but also making the websites...

item.title: JavaScript Array Functions Cheat Sheet
item.description: A Cheat Sheet to quickly find all functions that can be executed on a JavaScript Array. It includes a quick explanation, the syntax, an example, and the browser support.
item.content:encoded: A Cheat Sheet to quickly find all functions that can be executed on a JavaScript Array. It includes a quick explanation, the syntax, an example, and the browser support.
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: Creative Hover Effects

item.title: Getting started with React Query - Easy server state management in React
item.description: Handling state, which comes from the server can really cause some headaches in React. There is a lot you have to think about when dealing with asynchronous data, like updating, caching...
item.content:encoded: Handling state, which comes from the server can really cause some headaches in React. There is a lot you have to think about when dealing with asynchronous data, like updating, caching...
item.author: info@wweb.dev (Vincent Will)

item.title: How to speed up kickstarting new projects with Yeoman
item.description: I found myself often copy pasting code from other projects when starting new projects. This is why I created a Yeoman generator, which setups a nextjs project with styled components...

item.title: How to build a static website without frameworks using npm scripts
item.description: Sometimes it makes total sense to build an old fashioned static website. It can be not only faster, but also simplier than throwing in a full JavaScript framework just to build a website with only a few pages...
item.content:encoded: Sometimes it makes total sense to build an old fashioned static website. It can be not only faster, but also simplier than throwing in a full JavaScript framework just to build a website with only a few pages...
